intro: Klasea abulensis, commonly known as the Abulensian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Klasea abulensis is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic appeal.
